snippet: The officers, whose job is to keep NATO and Pakistan informed about each other’s military missions, were forced to leave after an American airstrike mistakenly killed 24 Pakistani soldiers.
abstract: Two American military officers, in a small step toward repairing the badly frayed relations between the United States and Pakistan, have quietly returned as liaisons to a major Pakistani Army headquarters in Peshawar, the gateway to the country’s restive tribal areas; the officers, whose job is to keep NATO and Pakistan informed about each other’s military missions, had been forced to leave after an American airstrike mistakenly killed 24 Pakistani soldiers.
lead_paragraph: The officers, whose job is to keep NATO and Pakistan informed about each other’s military missions, were forced to leave after an American airstrike mistakenly killed 24 Pakistani soldiers.

headline.seo: U.S. Liaisons Restored To Outpost In Pakistan
